com.badlogic.gdx.graphics
Class PerspectiveCamera

java.lang.Object
  com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.PerspectiveCamera

public class PerspectiveCamera
extends java.lang.Object

A perspective camera, having a position, a direction an up vector, a near plane, a far plane and a field of view. Use the PerspectiveCamera.setViewport() method to set the viewport from which the aspect ratio is derrived from, then call PerspectiveCamera.update() to update all the camera matrices as well as the Frustum. The combined matrix (projection, modelview) can be retrieved via a call to PerspectiveCamera.getCombinedMatrix() and directly passed to Application.loadMatrix(). You can also get a picking ray via PerspectiveCamera.getPickRay().

Author:
mzechner

public void update()
Updates all matrices as well as the Frustum based on the last set parameters for position, direction, up vector, field of view, near and far plane and viewport.

setMatrices

public void setMatrices(Application app)
Sets the projection and model view matrix of the Application to this camera's projection and model view matrix. Any previously set matrices of the Application are overwritten. Upon returning from this method the matrix mode of the Application is set to model view.

Parameters:
app - The Application.

getPickRay

public Ray getPickRay(int screenX,
                      int screenY)
Returns a ray in world space form the given screen coordinates. This can be used for picking. The returned Ray is an internal member of this class to reduce memory allocations. Do not reuse it outside of this class.

Parameters:
screenX - The screen x-coordinate
mouse_y - The screen y-coordinate
Returns:
The picking ray

project

public void project(Vector pos)
Projects the given vector in world space to screen space, overwritting the x- and y-coordinate of the provided vector.

Parameters:
pos - The vector to project
